title: Old Quebec
description: A historic district recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The narrow cobblestone streets, beautiful buildings with French architecture, and numerous cafes create a unique atmosphere. Important landmarks such as the Château Frontenac and Place Royale are located here.

title: Montmorency Falls
description: A stunning natural attraction that is 30 meters higher than Niagara Falls. Visitors can admire the view from a suspension bridge or take a cable car to the top.

title: Plains of Abraham
description: A historic park in the heart of Quebec City where the famous 1759 battle took place. The area is now a scenic spot for picnics, walking, and cultural events.

title: Île d'Orléans
description: A picturesque island near Quebec City, known for its charming villages, local food, and beautiful landscapes. A perfect spot for a peaceful day trip.

title: Musée de la Civilisation
description: A modern museum offering engaging exhibits on Quebec's culture, history, and indigenous heritage. A must-visit for culture enthusiasts.

title: Petit-Champlain District
description: A charming neighborhood with narrow streets, boutique shops, and inviting cafes. Known for its artistic vibe and beautiful decorations, especially during winter.

title: Citadel of Quebec
description: An impressive star-shaped fortress that offers panoramic views of the city. Visitors can learn about its history and enjoy the daily changing of the guard ceremony.

title: Laurentian Mountains
description: A beautiful mountain range offering year-round outdoor activities. Popular for skiing in winter and hiking or kayaking in the summer.
